reviewText: Originally, this game was completely incomprehensible (a death sentence for any visual novel). The latest fix (May, 16th, 2016) somewhat helped with that issue and made the thing understandable. However, it is still far away from a good translation or an enjoyable reading experience as there is still a automated translation" kind of feeling to the whole thing and lots of lines are just vaguely making sense

reviewText:
Broken english simulator 2016.

This is an eclectic, off the beaten path kind of game - if you dont mind reading A LOT, and have the patience, this is pretty interesting; if only for its efforts to be something new.

Think - goosebumps choose your own adventure with late 80's PC graphics and broken english.

reviewText:
Product received for free

My full review can be found on The Backlog.[www.the-backlog.net]

Cyber City 2157 follows a crazy day in the life of someone living in a city that is constantly growing. You'll follow him from his dream before he wakes up all the way until something happens to him based on the choices you make. I found the story somewhat hard to understand, partially due to the build I played having some absolutely horrendous English. Some fixes have been made to it since then but there is still a lot of broken English littered throughout.

The graphics can sometimes be hard on the eyes while reading, especially if they're trying to move at the same time. The sounds are nothing to write home about, and I often found myself wondering if I had heard them somewhere before.

Even if the English gets completely fixed, I have a hard time recommending this game. The story is all over the place, and the current state of the English doesn't help, nor do the sometimes harsh on your eyes graphics.

Disclaimer: I was provided a key by the publisher for review purposes.

reviewText: This visual novel has a ton of plot threads across multiple branches, and none of them, including the hook that begins the game, get resolved. It includes themes such as the creation of holographic AI copies of humans called Molds"
date: endless urbanization to the point where new locations appear without anyone noticing or caring
recommended: apathy to the point of confusing strangers for acquaintances
helpfulPercent: changes color by rotating in sections throughout the sky instead of setting; none of these ideas are ever fully expounded upon. The few characters that exist never have their arcs finished — sometimes their endings leave more questions than answers. Indeed
votesHelpful: several of the story paths conclude on an "End of Side A" screen; if there is a Side B forthcoming
votesTotal: I've seen no evidence of that.\n\nCoupled with photographs intentionally dithered to look like they're being displayed on an old computer monitor
votesFunny: as well as the English script that only barely rises above the cusp of Google Translated legibility
commentsCount: you'd think Cyber City 2157 could only be a project by people who spilled their stream of consciousness into an esoteric project to intentionally fleece and / or baffle anyone who stumbled across it. A quintessential Bad Game masquerading as Art.\n\nYet
column16: even if that is actually the case
column17: Cyber City 2157 somehow all comes together to create an experience that is strangely pleasing to read — and I use the word 'read' very loosely
column18: as a lot of my amusement came from deciphering what the narrative was trying to communicate in words either too many or too few. The eccentric cast members
column19: while most show up only for one scene
column21: and the eclectic soundtrack fits the journey perfectly. I wouldn't recommend Cyber City 2157 at the normal price
column22: but if you can get it for cheap or free it is a truly unique excursion that I suspect a few of you may end up defining as your ~aesthetic~.\n\nIn conclusion

reviewText:
Let's move straight to pros and cons of this game:

PROS
+ Classic nice NES graphics
+ Relaxing audio
+ Exciting game story
+ Player can choose ending by himself

CONS
- There are no achievements.
- It took less than 2 hours to get it done.
- Ambiance is not that good.



In my opinion, if you are looking to spend around 2 hours with old NES graphics with some good chilling music - this game is for you.

reviewText: Game ended too quickly. I sat and spoke with the statue of Lady Alanis for the entire duration and then it just ended with us looking at the moon with a very vague story. I thought I would be able to proceed after our discussion but no, this was not the case. The verbiage is clearly written by a foreigner as  a lot the writing required decyphering.

reviewText: Интерактивная новелла с интересным визуальным ретро-стилем. Местами кажется, что вернулся в 80-е годы и сидишь за CGA монитором. Но это никак ни недостаток игры, а скорей ее фирменная фишка, которая выделяет ее на фоне других игр этого жанра. Стилизировать под ретро - это надо еще уметь и разработчики прекрасно с этим справились, на мой взгляд. В общем рекомендовано любителям жанра.
